newsitem.title: FRANCE: Airbus confirms stock listing is a possibility.
newsitem.headline: Airbus confirms stock listing is a possibility.

text.p: A spokesman for the Airbus Industrie consortium said that a stock market listing was among the long-term options for allowing external partners in the group.
"That is one of the possibilities, but you have to ask the partners about the details," Airbus spokesman Robert Alizart said by telephone from Toulouse.
He spoke after the partners signed an agreement to turn the consortium into a single corporate entity before the end of 1999.

In a statement on the agreement, Airbus had said that the restructured company would facilitate continuing improvement in overall operational efficiency, the introduction of new international strategic partnerships and the longer term opportunity for "external participation" in Airbus.

Airbus Industrie is a consortium made up of French state-owned Ste Nationale Industrielle Aerospatiale, British Aerospace Plc, Daimler-Benz Aerospace, a unit of Daimler-Benz AG and Construcciones Aeronauticas SA (CASA) of Spain.
Alizart said that the companies would mandate a bank to study and valuate the assets needed to be transferred to the new company. This study needs to be completed before the end of 1997.
